result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Latishia M Boyer

records.addlTxt: Bail sheet emailed to Atty Dvoran for def's signature.

Absolute sobriety. No alcohol. No drugs. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. No contact with: DD. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. No violent contact with RH. Not to discuss case with RH.

10:41 AM Defendant Latishia M Boyer in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Latishia M Boyer.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Counsel advises has received discovery and Defendant is currently in treatment. Statement by Victim RH requesting no contact be lifted. Court amends bail conditions to no violent contact with RH.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Defendant Latishia M Boyer appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Latishia M Boyer.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel previously efiled waiver of preliminary hearing questionnaire.  Court examines Defendant, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Discussion held on bail conditions. Arguments. Court denies request.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Clerk received voicemail from RH requesting no contact order be lifted. Clerk forwarded information to Victim Witness Coordinator.

Absolute sobriety. No alcohol. No drugs. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. No contact with: DD or RH. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.

1:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Latishia M Boyer appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Latishia M Boyer. Defendant qualifies for PD. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $8,000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests signature bond. Defendant is on PO hold. Counsel waives time limits and requests status.
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
